[crew member] If you keep it focused, we can go from the beginning.

translation.en: Okay, I can tell... I can try to tell a story, but how far do you want me to go before I stop?
translation.ko: 얘기할 수는 있는데 어느 정도까지 하나요?

translation.en: You know, what's your next question?
[crew member] You can go all the way to...
-Okay, okay. I'll try, I'll try. -[indistinct chatter]

-Don't be an actor. You're a real guy! -[laughs]

translation.en: from wiretapping phone conversations...
about what happened to me.
[Dan] Let me just tell you something.
It was very inappropriate, the way the police went about doing what they did.
[man] Well, once again, Mr. Schneider, I resent the implication.
translation.ko: 또 이러시네요, 슈나이더 씨 이러니 제가 화가 나죠

translation.en: [Dan] My son was murdered...
buying crack in the Lower 9th Ward.
The police have the attitude that it's another drug deal gone bad.
translation.ko: 경찰은 '또 어디서 마약 거래 하다가 사고가 났네'라는 식이었죠

translation.en: And these kids maybe got what they deserved.
translation.ko: 이런 애들은 당할 만한 짓을 해서 그런 거라고요

translation.en: [man] You are not going to dictate to me. I'm talking.
[woman] You don't talk to people like that who just lost a son. We lost a son.

translation.ko: 아들을 잃은 건 우리예요 저 양반이 아니라고요, 알겠어요?

translation.en: He didn't lose a son!
[Dan] The New Orleans Police Department was corrupt
and almost none of the murders were ever solved.
But I was determined to get the killer off the street

[reporter 1] In other news, a St. Bernard family
translation.ko: 다음은 세인트버나드의 어느 가족이 정의를 위한 캠페인에 나섰다는 소식입니다

translation.ko: 23세의 대니 슈나이더는 자기 픽업트럭에서 총을 맞았죠

translation.en: Police say that they have little to go on.
translation.ko: 경찰은 수사를 더 진행할 수 없다고 합니다

[crying] He was a good kid.
He didn't deserve this.
In my fight to get Danny some justice,
translation.ko: 대니를 위해 정의를 실현하려는 제 싸움을 통해

translation.en: I promise I will work hard...
translation.ko: 다른 사람의 생명을 구할 수 있도록

translation.en: to try to save other lives.
At first, my mission was to get justice for my son.
translation.ko: 처음에 제 사명은 아들을 위해 정의를 실현하는 거였죠

translation.en: But then I started noticing, in the drugstore,
translation.ko: 하지만 그때 약국에서 깨닫게 된 것이 있어요

translation.en: an unusual amount of high-powered opiate prescriptions.
translation.ko: 강력한 아편 진통제 처방이 이례적으로 많다는 거죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] Chalmette pharmacist Daniel Schneider says
he's taken a leave of absence from his drugstore job
to crusade against the illegal use of OxyContin.
translation.ko: 옥시콘틴의 불법 이용과 싸우는 십자군이 되기로 했습니다

translation.en: [Dan] There was a certain doctor using her license
to virtually decimate my community.
-Not only did I see malpractice... -[pills shake] ...I saw corruption, I saw conspiracy.
translation.ko: 저는 의료 과실뿐 아니라 부패와 음모를 목격했어요

translation.en: People were dying every week.
-[cameras clicking] -Eighteen, and 20, and 25-year-old kids.
I could see my son's face in their face.
translation.ko: 그들의 얼굴에서 제 아들의 얼굴을 보았습니다

translation.en: -[sirens wail] -[voice breaking] I couldn't save my son.
But I can save some other kids.
And I'm not gonna let this drug continue to kill.
translation.ko: 이 약 때문에 사람들이 계속 죽는 일은 없게 할 겁니다

translation.en: I started realizing that there was a bigger mission here.
translation.ko: 더 큰 사명이 있다는 것을 깨닫게 됐습니다

translation.en: OxyContin. It was produced by Purdue Pharma.
-And I saw this opiate epidemic... -[pills rattle] ...in its infancy.
translation.ko: 저는 초기부터 이 진통제가 확산되는 걸 봤습니다

translation.ko: 우린 이 나라 전역에서 중독자를 만들어내고 있었어요

translation.ko: 퍼듀 파머는 이 약의 생산을 중단할 수 있었지만

translation.ko: 그 회사는 수십만 명이 사망한 위기 상황을 초래했어요

translation.en: -What price have they paid? -[dramatic instrumentals fade]

translation.en: We used to call it God's Country.
Kind of sandwiched between the Mississippi River
and, really, the swamps.

We have two major oil refineries,
and fishermen and crabbing and oystering.

translation.ko: 길가에는 새우를 파는 사람들이 늘 있죠

translation.ko: 아버지는 제가 어릴 때 오빠와 저를 데리고 다니셨죠

translation.en: He'd tell us on a Sunday, "We're gonna take a ride to the end of the world."
translation.ko: 아버지는 일요일이면 이러셨어요 '차 타고 세상 끝까지 가 보자'

translation.en: He would drive us down, way down deep into the parish...
translation.ko: 우리를 차에 태우고 패리시 안쪽 깊숙이 들어가셨죠

translation.en: past Chalmette, Meraux, Poydras and Violet.
Way down to the end where Delacroix Island was.
And it was the Gulf of Mexico.
And he'd just say, "Here's the waters."
"Here's the Gulf. This is the end of the world to us."
And we always thought that was the end of the world for everybody.
translation.ko: 저희는 늘 그곳이 모든 이들에게 세상의 끝이라고 생각했죠

translation.en: [Dan] I started out in football as a lineman.
I actually had pretty good hands and I had great speed.
-[sentimental instrumentals] -But I was blind as a bat.
-[whistle blows] -We had a tremendous football season.
When I saw Annie, she was just the cutest thing.
[Annie] I was a grade lower than him.
I liked his personality.
[Dan] I don't think I won her over because of my looks, okay?
translation.ko: 애니가 외모 때문에 저랑 만난 거 같진 않아요

translation.en: But we just really fell in love with each other.
[Annie] We got married a couple of years after high school.
translation.ko: 고등학교를 졸업하고 몇 년 후에 결혼했죠

translation.en: I really didn't know what I wanted to do, to be quite honest with you.
translation.ko: 제가 뭘 하고 싶은지 솔직히 모르고 있었어요

translation.en: A friend of mine talked about the pharmacists having a great job.
translation.ko: 약사가 좋은 일자리를 얻는다는 얘기를 제 친구가 하더라고요

translation.en: Didn't have a great interest in it. It's just...
translation.ko: 아주 흥미가 있었던 건 아니었어요, 그저...

translation.en: I had to pick out something real quick
where I could reach my goals of having kids and having a house.
translation.ko: 아이와 집을 갖겠다는 제 목표를 이루기 위해서는요

translation.en: I became a pharmacist in 1975.
-[cars rushing] -I worked for Bradley's Pharmacy.

being able to actually feel like I was helping 'em.
I picked pharmacy and then I... I stuck with it.
[Dan] Aw, look who had a bath.

translation.ko: 결혼 후 5년이 돼서야 첫째 아이 대니를 낳았어요

translation.en: It was wonderful to have a little boy to...
translation.ko: 같이 놀 꼬마 아이가 있다는 건

translation.en: play with.
He was a good kid. Gentle and caring. He was just always happy.
[Dan] Then we had a daughter, Kristi.
[Kristi] My family was very, very close, growing up.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 저희 가족은 아주 친밀했어요

[Kristi] My dad, every year, wanted to get a tree...

[Annie] This is 1989.

translation.en: [Annie] Going on the plane from...

translation.ko: 제 아들은 정말 온순하고 인정 많은 아이였어요

translation.ko: 좀 더 나이가 들자 평화 운동가가 됐죠

translation.ko: 그 머스탱으로 멀리 드라이브 갈 생각이었죠

translation.en: We both loved that car.
translation.ko: 우린 둘 다 차를 정말 좋아했어요

translation.ko: 차를 타고 가서 제 가족이 예전에 살았던 곳을 봤죠

translation.en: My family moved out of the 9th Ward

[man] As a child growing up in the city,

translation.ko: 많은 아프리카계 미국인들이 로워나인스워드에 집을 샀죠

translation.en: and white Americans moved into St. Bernard.

translation.ko: 두 개의 서로 다른 세계 같았죠

translation.ko: 차에 검둥이라고 쓰고 어딘가에 낙서를 했죠

translation.ko: 모두 함께 모여서 즐거운 시간을 보내는 거죠

translation.ko: 그때도 알고 있었어요 나인스워드에서 마약을 사다가

translation.ko: 총 맞고 죽은 세인트버나드 애들이 여럿이라는 걸요

translation.en: And, much as I hate to say it...
